latest news.eng_title: Tesla's Comeback: Can the Company Surpass the 200 Euro Mark?
latest news.summary: Tesla is attempting to make a comeback in the upward trend, but it still needs to surpass the 200 Euro mark, according to chart analysts. However, the company may face a new challenge as J.D. Power has lowered its sales forecast for US electric vehicles for the current year. This is not a positive development for Tesla, which is already struggling with declining global demand. As a result, the market reaction to Tesla's stock has been a downward trend, but chart technicians believe that the 200 Euro mark is still achievable and important. As Chartanalysten said, 'It's going to take more than just a few days to turn the trend around, but we're optimistic that Tesla can make a comeback.'
latest news.title: Tesla-Aktie: Noch 12!

latest news.eng_title: Canada Introduces 100% Tariff on Chinese Electric Vehicles
latest news.summary: Canada is introducing a 100% tariff on Chinese electric vehicles, effective from October 1, 2024. This move aims to protect the domestic automotive industry, giving local manufacturers a fair chance to compete, according to BBC. The tariff will apply to all imported electric vehicles from China, including hybrids, trucks, buses, and delivery vehicles, even those produced by Tesla in Shanghai. The import of Chinese vehicles to Canada has increased significantly, with a 460% surge in 2023, mainly due to Tesla's shipments from Shanghai. This influx has put pressure on both domestic manufacturers and the government, leading to the decision to impose the drastic measure. 'Canada is taking a stronger stance than the EU,' the article notes. 'This move is a response to the overwhelming import of Chinese vehicles, which has put a strain on the domestic market.'
latest news.title: Kanada: 100 procent tull på kinesiska elbilar

latest news.eng_title: U.S. Share of Electric & Hybrid Vehicle Sales Increased in 2nd Quarter of 2024
latest news.summary: The share of electric and hybrid vehicle sales in the United States increased to 18.7% in the second quarter of 2024, up from 17.8% in the first quarter. Hybrid electric vehicle sales drove this increase, rising by 30.7% year over year. Luxury electric vehicles continued to sell well, accounting for 32.8% of total luxury sales. Tesla's market share of electric vehicle sales decreased to 48.9% in 2Q24, the lowest since 4Q17. Ford became the second-largest electric vehicle manufacturer, driven by sales of the Mustang Mach-E and F-150 Lightning. The majority of electric vehicles sold in the US were manufactured in North America, with 74.4% of sales coming from domestic production in 2Q24. However, not all vehicles manufactured in North America qualify for the clean vehicle tax credits due to domestic content requirements.
latest news.title: U.S. Share of Electric & Hybrid Vehicle Sales Increased in 2nd Quarter of 2024

latest news.eng_title: Tesla's Price Cuts Spark Surge in Used Electric Vehicle Sales
latest news.summary: Tesla's recent price cuts have led to a 70% increase in used electric vehicle (EV) sales in the first half of 2024, with the average price of a used EV dropping below $30,000. According to General Manager Henry Melendez of CarMax Inc.'s superstore in Fremont, California, 'We've seen a really good amount of interest. They've always wanted to get into an electric vehicle, but it just wasn't quite as affordable.' The increased supply of used EVs, now four times higher than in 2021, is also boosting demand. Government incentives, such as the $4,000 tax credit for used EVs under $25,000, are making used EVs more affordable. Jessica Caldwell from Edmunds notes that Tesla's limited updates to its models make used versions appealing since they look similar to new ones. Used EVs are selling faster than gas cars, especially for models priced between $20,000 and $30,000, which are selling within 30 to 36 days compared to 39 days for gas cars.
latest news.title: Tesla's Price Cuts Spark Surge in Used Electric Vehicle Sales

latest news.eng_title: Hyundai's Ambitious Plan to Overtake Tesla and VW: 30% More Sales by 2030
latest news.summary: Hyundai Motor presented its new strategy 'Hyundai Way' at the CEO Investor Day 2024, focusing on electrification. The company aims to sell 5.55 million vehicles worldwide by 2030, a 30% increase from 2023, with 2 million electric vehicles sold annually. New Extended Range Electric Vehicles (EREV) with a range of over 900 kilometers per charge will be introduced in North America and China. Hyundai plans to offer a full range of 21 electric vehicle models by 2030. Meanwhile, copper prices have corrected after reaching highs in May, with experts predicting a supercycle due to supply shortages. The current correction may be an opportunity to invest in copper producers, such as the three companies highlighted in a new report. 'Hyundai Way' is expected to be a significant challenge to Tesla and other competitors in the electric vehicle market.
latest news.title: CEO Investor Day 2024: Hyundais Kampfansage an Tesla, VW und Co: 30 Prozent mehr Verkäufe bis 2030!

latest news.summary: Tesla's future growth is expected to be driven by its expanding energy storage and battery businesses, as well as its development of autonomous vehicles. The company's Shanghai and Berlin gigafactories are expected to reach full capacity by 2026, allowing Tesla to avoid Chinese and European tariffs and create surplus inventory for export. The company's Robotaxi business is expected to launch in 2027, with a projected price of $393.60 and a 48.75% gain. By 2028-29, Tesla's Robotaxi business is expected to account for up to 90% of the company's enterprise value and earnings. The company's stock price is expected to reach $470.00 by 2030, with a cumulative gain of +124.65% over the next 5 years.
latest news.title: Tesla (TSLA) Price Prediction and Forecast

latest news.summary: Tesla's stock has been in the red this year, down about 10%, due to slowing electric vehicle (EV) sales growth and increasing competition in the market. The company's deliveries dropped by 5% in the second quarter to 443,956, while automotive revenue fell by 7% to $19.88 billion. Consumers are worried about the high costs of battery replacements, which can cost up to $20,000, and the subsequent high depreciation EVs are seeing as they age. As a result, hybrid vehicle sales have climbed 41% and plug-in hybrid (PHEV) sales have jumped 49%. Tesla's robotaxi business, which is being developed, is seen as a potential game-changer, but its success is not yet proven. Cathie Wood of Ark Invest believes that the robotaxi business will eventually become 86% of Tesla's earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization (EBITDA) in 2029, but this is a highly uncertain scenario. Other players in the robotaxi space, such as Waymo, are already operating in multiple cities and have seen significant growth. Tesla's valuation is also a concern, with a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 48.5, which is much higher than traditional automakers. Investors who believe in Elon Musk's vision for the company should continue to hold the stock, but those who are skeptical should consider selling.
latest news.title: Tesla: Buy, Sell, or Hold?

latest news.eng_title: Canada to Impose 100% Tariffs on Tesla's Chinese-Made Cars
latest news.summary: The Canadian government has included Tesla in the list of automakers penalized by tariffs on the importation of electric cars. The US-based automaker will be affected by the new 100% tariffs on the shipment of Tesla Model 3 and Tesla Model Y cars to Canada. This increase in tariffs threatens to raise prices in the coming months, as Tesla has already done in Europe and the US with the announcement of tariffs due to the commercial war. According to Statistics Canada, the value of Chinese electric vehicles imported by Canada increased to $2.2 billion last year, up from less than $100 million in 2022. This increase came after Tesla began shipping Model Y vehicles from its Shanghai factory. The Canadian government is primarily concerned that cheap Chinese-made cars from manufacturers like BYD, Omoda, or MG may appear in the market, as has happened in Europe. BYD informed the Canadian government in July that it intends to pressure lawmakers and officials on its plans to enter the country. The additional tax on electric vehicles will come into effect on October 1 and will also include certain passenger cars, trucks, buses, and hybrid delivery vans. It will be added to an existing tariff of 6.1% that applies to Chinese electric vehicles. The EU has also announced a proposal to impose new tariffs on electric vehicles imported from China, but at lower levels than those proposed by the US and Canada. SAIC Motor Corp. products face additional tariffs of 36.3%, while Geely Automobile Holdings and BYD face tariffs of 19.3% and 17% respectively, according to a draft decision published by the EU on August 20. Tesla will see an additional 9% charge on vehicles made in China, as stated by Elon Musk, 'It is a great day'.
latest news.title: Canadá copia a Europa y también penalizará a Tesla por producir sus coches en China con aranceles del 100%

latest news.eng_title: Tesla China sees 14,200 new vehicle registrations in Q3's eighth week
latest news.summary: Tesla China saw 14,200 new vehicle registrations in the week of August 19-25, 2024, suggesting a strong finish to Q3 2024. According to industry watcher Gary Black, Tesla China's third quarter 2024 registrations are up 10% year over year and 30% quarter-over-quarter. If Tesla maintains this momentum, it could post one of its strongest quarters in China to date. Elon Musk has expressed confidence that Tesla could exceed its 2023 results this year, with Q3 and Q4 performance being crucial to achieving this goal. In comparison, Tesla sold 1,808,581 vehicles in FY 2023, and has delivered 830,776 vehicles globally between Q1 and Q2 2024, with 426,623 vehicles coming from Giga Shanghai.
latest news.title: Tesla China sees 14,200 new vehicle registrations in Q3's eighth week

news knowledge.eng_title: Tesla Reports Q2 2024 Financial Results: Revenue Up, Profits Down
news knowledge.summary: Tesla's Q2 2024 financial results have been released, showing a 2% increase in revenue compared to the same period last year, reaching $25.50 billion. However, profits have decreased due to a lower number of cars delivered. Tesla delivered 443,956 cars in the second quarter of 2024, a 4.6% decrease compared to the same period last year. The company's auto division revenue has decreased by 7% to $19.8 billion. Despite this, Tesla's Energy Storage segment is expanding rapidly, with 9.4 GWh of implementations and record revenues and profits. The company is also working on its robotaxi project, with a potential launch date of October 10. 'We have achieved record revenues, overcoming operational challenges. The Energy Storage segment is rapidly expanding, reaching 9.4 GWh of implementations and registering unprecedented revenues and profits. Vehicle deliveries have increased due to renewed consumer optimism.'
news knowledge.title: Tesla aumenta il fatturato nel Q2 2024, ma calano gli utili

news knowledge.eng_title: Tesla's Q2 Deliveries Strong, But What's To Come?
news knowledge.summary: Tesla's Q2 deliveries were strong, but the company is still facing an electric vehicle (EV) demand problem. Despite a 42% one-month rally, Tesla's production and deliveries are set to decline in 2024. The company needs to report strong sequential growth in Q3 and Q4 to ease concerns. Energy storage was a bright spot, with a record 9.4 GWh in deployments, but its contribution to revenue and gross profit is not yet significant enough to drive a meaningful EPS beat. Tesla's margins are still under pressure, with automotive operating margin dropping to 5.5% in Q1 2024, and the company has provided no concrete guidance on how far margins will decline.
news knowledge.title: Tesla's Q2 Deliveries Strong, But What's To Come?

news knowledge.eng_title: Tesla's Q2 Deliveries Surprised, But Was Stock's 10% Rally Justified?
news knowledge.summary: Tesla's Q2 deliveries exceeded expectations, with 443,956 vehicles sold, a 15% increase from Q1 2024. Despite this, the stock price rose only 10% due to various factors affecting demand, including high interest rates, competition, and a rising inventory of unsold vehicles. Tesla's Q2 production was 410,831 vehicles, a 7.5% decrease from deliveries. The company's global vehicle inventory, measured in days of supply, rose to 28 days in Q1 2024, but is likely to decline in Q2. The average price of Tesla vehicles dropped to under $45,000 in Q1 2024, and gross margins decreased by 200 basis points compared to the same quarter last year. The company reduced prices by $2,000 for three models, including the Model Y, Models X, and S. Tesla's stock has seen little change over the past three years, while the S&P 500 has increased by 45%. The company's valuation is estimated at $177 per share, 20% below the current market price.
news knowledge.title: Tesla's Q2 Deliveries Surprised, But Was Stock's 10% Rally Justified?

news knowledge.eng_title: Tesla beats expectations on car deliveries - is now the time to buy?
news knowledge.summary: Tesla has reported a 14% increase in car deliveries in the second quarter, beating expectations. The company delivered 443,956 vehicles, up from the previous quarter. Despite this, deliveries were down nearly 5% compared to the same period in 2023. Analysts are cautious about the company's future, citing the competitive EV market and regulatory challenges. Tesla is planning to release a new, more affordable line of vehicles in early 2025, which could boost the company's share price. However, the economic outlook is uncertain, and the company's battle for market share continues.
news knowledge.title: Tesla beats expectations on car deliveries - is now the time to buy?

news knowledge.eng_title: Tesla's Q2 deliveries beat estimates on price cuts, incentives
news knowledge.summary: Tesla reported a 5% drop in vehicle deliveries in Q2, beating estimates due to price cuts and incentives. The company delivered 443,956 vehicles, with 422,405 being Model 3 and Model Y, and 21,551 other models. Tesla's CEO, Elon Musk, expects increased deliveries in 2024, but Wall Street expects a drop due to poor sentiment around electric vehicles and high interest rates.
news knowledge.title: Tesla's Q2 deliveries beat estimates on price cuts, incentives

news knowledge.eng_title: Tesla stock climbs as Q2 vehicle deliveries beat expectations for first time in year
news knowledge.summary: Tesla reported a 14.8% increase in vehicle deliveries in the second quarter of 2024, beating expectations for the first time in a year. The company delivered 443,956 vehicles, with 422,405 being Model 3 or Model Y. This marks the first delivery beat in four quarters. Analysts are optimistic about the company's future, with Wedbush Analytics raising their price target and calling the report a 'major turning point'. The company will release its second quarter earnings on July 19, with an earnings call scheduled for 5:30 ET.
news knowledge.title: Tesla stock climbs as Q2 vehicle deliveries beat expectations for first time in year

news knowledge.eng_title: Tesla's Q2 Delivery Numbers Exceed Estimates, Stock Up 6.3%
news knowledge.summary: Tesla announced its production and delivery numbers for the second quarter of 2024. The company delivered 443,956 vehicles, exceeding Wall Street estimates. The stock is currently up 6.3% to $223.16 per share. Tesla's delivery numbers are expected to be affected by the decline in demand and the decrease in prices. The company's current lineup includes the Model Y crossover, Model 3 sedan, Cybertruck, Model X SUV, and Model S luxury sedan. Tesla's delivery numbers have been impacted by the decline in sales, which was partly due to the closure of its factory in Germany due to a fire and delays in shipping due to conflicts in the Red Sea. The company's stock has fallen 16% this year, despite a 6% increase on Monday. Tesla is offering discounts and incentives to boost sales. In China, the company is currently offering a zero-interest loan to customers who purchase a Model 3 or Model Y by July 31. According to its annual report for 2023, Tesla generated around $21.75 billion in revenue from China, which accounts for 22.5% of its total sales.
news knowledge.title: عاجل: تفاصيل تسليمات تسلا..السهم يصعد بقوة

news knowledge.eng_title: Tesla's Q2 Deliveries Exceed Expectations Despite Price Cuts and Incentives
news knowledge.summary: Tesla reported a 4.8% decrease in vehicle deliveries in the second quarter, exceeding expectations due to price cuts and incentives. The company delivered 443,956 vehicles, beating the average analyst estimate of 438,019. Tesla's stock rose 4.5% in pre-market trading. The company's CEO, Elon Musk, expects an increase in deliveries in 2024 compared to last year, despite Wall Street's expectations of a decline due to low demand and high interest rates. Tesla's deliveries have been impacted by price cuts and incentives, as well as a shift in focus towards profitability over growth. The company has abandoned its goal of delivering 20 million vehicles per year by 2030, citing a more conservative growth outlook.
news knowledge.title: Les livraisons de Tesla au deuxième trimestre dépassent les estimations grâce aux baisses de prix et aux incitations

news knowledge.eng_title: Tesla reports Q2 delivery and production figures, beating estimates
news knowledge.summary: Tesla reported its Q2 delivery and production figures, beating estimates. The company delivered 443,956 vehicles, exceeding the 438,019 expected by Wall Street. However, this is a decrease from Q2 2023, when Tesla delivered over 466,000 vehicles. Tesla also reported producing 410,831 vehicles and deploying 9.4 GWh of energy storage products, a record high. The company's stock rose 9.71% in pre-market trading, pushing gains up to nearly $220 per share. Tesla will report its Q2 financials on July 23, 2024, and will release a Shareholder Deck and Earnings Call.
news knowledge.title: Tesla reports Q2 delivery and production figures, beating estimates

news knowledge.summary: Tesla is set to report its second-quarter 2024 deliveries, and analysts expect a jump in deliveries from the previous quarter but a drop compared to the same quarter in 2023. The company has a lot to prove after a disappointing Q1, and its upcoming Robotaxi unveiling and increased Cybertruck production could boost deliveries. However, execution is key, and CEO Elon Musk's pay package resolution has eliminated distractions, allowing the company to focus on growth. Analysts expect 438,019 Tesla deliveries in Q2, which may concern some investors.
news knowledge.title: What Wall Street is expecting
